name: optimism
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
C2 the quality of being full of hope and emphasizing the good parts of a situation, or a belief that something good will happen: There was a note of optimism in his voice as he spoke about the company's future. They had cause/grounds/reason for cautious optimism about an improvement in her medical condition. Opposite
pessimism
More examplesFewer examplesIn spite of the scale of the famine, the relief workers struggled on with dauntless optimism and commitment.Her optimism seemed to infect all those around her.The prevailing mood is one of optimism.The prime minister's speech was intended to purvey a message of optimism.International support has given rise to a new optimism in the company.
